name: SamplingStrata
description: Optimal Stratification of Sampling Frames for Multipurpose Sampling Surveys.

name: R2BEAT
description: Multistage Sampling Allocation and PSU Selection.

name: SDMX_Matrix_Generator
description: Excel-based visual SDMX artefact authoring tool which generates SDMX-ML for upload into an SDMX repository such as a registry. By OECD.

name: sampling
description: Several algorithms for drawing survey samples, including a variety of unequal probabiltiy sampling designs (high entropy, systematic, Rao-Sampford, etc.), and calibrating design weights.

name: surveyplanning
description: Tools for sample survey planning, including sample size calculation, estimation of expected precision for the estimates of totals, and calculation of optimal sample size allocation.

name: PracTools
description: Functions and datasets related to Valliant, Dever, and Kreuter (2018 2nd ed), [*Practical Tools for Designing and Weighting Survey Samples*](https://doi.org/10.1007/978-3-319-93632-1).

name: prnsamplr
description: Coordinated stratified sampling using permanent random numbers (PRN's). Supports simple random sampling and probability-proportional-to-size sampling and includes a function for transforming PRN's to control the sample overlap.

name: sps
description: Implements the sequential Poisson method for drawing probability-proportional-to-size samples. Includes tools to coordinate samples with permanent random numbers, draw stratified samples, and use other order-sampling methods.

name: samplingin
description: Sampling using systematic and PPS (Probability Proportional to Size) methods. It can also allocate predetermined allocations to smaller levels. by Statistics Indonesia

name: GUrlSearcher
description: An application for searching Urls via Google. Can be used to find websites of enterprise. By ISTAT.

name: Url_scorer
description: Gives a rule based score to scraped documents in a Solr database. By ISTAT.

name: RobotTool
description: A tool for checking (price) changes on the web. By Statistics Netherlands.

name: Social-Media-Presence
description: A script for detecting social media presence on enterprises websites. By the ESSnet project on Big Data.

name: Sustainability_Reporting
description: A script for measuring sustainability reporting from enterprises websites. By ONS.

name: urlfinding
description: Software for finding websites of enterprises using a search engine and machine learning. By [Statistics Netherlands](https:www.cbs.nl).

name: dcmodify
description: Derive new variables or modify data using externally defined data modification rules.

name: pysdmx
description: Python package focussing on simplicity, providing a subset of SDMX functionalities without requiring advanced knowledge of SDMX, see [docs](https://py.sdmx.io/). By BIS.

name: vtlengine
description: A Validation and Transformation Language (VTL) engine, written in Python, compatible with the SDMX standard using pysdmx. By [MeaningfulData](https://www.meaningfuldata.eu/)

name: Trevas
description: Java engine for the Validation and Transformation Language (VTL). By INSEE.

name: Java-VTL
description: A partial implementation of the Validation Transformation Language, based on the VTL 1.1 draft specification. By Statistics Norway.

name: blaise
description: Reading and writing Files in the Blaise Format from R. By Statistics Netherlands.

name: ADaMSoft
description: implements procedures for data analysis, data, web and text mining. Also contains procedures for data validation and imputation, based on the principle of Fellegi and Holt.

name: reclin2
description: Functions to assist in performing probabilistic record linkage and deduplication: generating pairs, comparing records, em-algorithm for estimating m- and u-probabilities, forcing one-to-one matching. Can also be used for pre- and post-processing for machine learning methods for record linkage.

name: RecordLinkage
description: Implementation of the Fellegi-Sunter method for record linkage.

name: StatMatch
description: Statistical Matching or Data Fusion

name: fastLink
description: Implements a Fellegi-Sunter probabilistic record linkage model that allows for missing data and the inclusion of auxiliary information. [Documentation](http://imai.princeton.edu/research/linkage.html).

name: stringdist
description: Approximate string matching. Supports various string distances (Damerau-Levenshtein, Hamming, Levenshtein, optimal sting alignment), qgrams (q- gram, cosine, jaccard distance) and heuristic metrics (Jaro, Jaro-Winkler). An implementation of soundex is provided as well.

name: fuzzyjoin
description: Join tables based on exact or similar matches. Allows for matching records based on inaccurate keys.

name: RELAIS
description: A toolkit providing techniques for dealing with record linkage. The purpose is to identify the same real world entity that can be differently represented in data sources. By Istat.

name: XBRL
description: Extraction of Business Financial Information from [XBRL](https://www.xbrl.org/).

name: validate
description: Data validation checks such as on length, format, range, missingness, availability, uniqueness, multivariate checks, statistical checks and checks on SDMX codelist. See [Cookbook](https://data-cleaning.github.io/validate/). By Statistics Netherlands.

name: validatedb
description: [validate](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=validate) on a SQL database, providing validation on bigger data.

name: validatetools
description: Checking validation rules on redundancies and contradictions. Useful if your validation rule set grows in complexity.

name: errorlocate
description: Error localisation based on Fellegi and Holt, supporting categorical and/or numeric data, linear equalities, inequalities and conditional rules and MIP-based error localization.

name: VIM
description: Visualisation and imputation of missing data. Imputation using (robust) linear regression methods or donor-based methods (kNN, hot-deck).

name: simputation
description: Front-end to (combinations of) advanced imputation methods following the [tidy tools manifesto](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/tidyverse/vignettes/manifesto.html). Supports regression (standard, M-estimation, ridge/lasso/elasticnet), hot-deck methods (powered by [VIM](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=VIM)), randomForest, EM-based, and iterative randomForest imputation. Reuse of fitted models and definition of simple user-defined methods are supported as well.

name: SeleMix
description: Detection of outliers and influential errors using a latent variable model for selective editing.

name: univOutl
description: Various methods for detecting univariate outliers.

name: extremevalues
description: Detection of univariate outliers based on modeling the bulk distribution.

name: deductive
description: Deductive correction and imputation using edit rules and (partially) complete data.

name: rspa
description: Adapt Numerical Records to Fit (in)Equality Restrictions.

name: mice
description: Multiple imputation by chained equations, aka fully conditional specification, accompanied by [van Buuren (2018) _Flexible Imputation of Missing Data_](https://stefvanbuuren.name/fimd/).

name: svrep
description: R package creating and working with survey replicate weights, extending functionality of the 'survey' package in R. Creates replicate weights using bootstrap, generalized bootstrap, generalized replication, and random-group jackknife methods. Facilitates sample-based calibration and nonresponse adjustment methods.

name: survey
description: Weighting and estimation for complex survey designs, possibly under nonresponse. Also computes estimator variance. See also R package [srvyr](https:://CRAN.R-project.org/package=survey) for integration with [tidy tools](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/tidyverse/vignettes/manifesto.html).

name: hbsae
description: Small area estimation based on hierarchical Bayesian models.

name: mcmcsae
description: Small area estimation based on Markov Chain Monte Carlo simulation.

name: rsae
description: Small area estimation based on (robust) maximum likelihood estimation.

name: CalibrateSSB
description: Calculate weighs and estimates for panel data with non-response.

name: jointCalib
description: Performs calibration of quantiles and a joint calibration of totals and quantiles.

name: PriceIndices
description: Calculating Bilateral and Multilateral Price Indexes.

name: ReGenesees
description: Like [survey](https://CRAN.r-project.org/package=survey), but with specific features (e.g. partitioned calibration) that make it fit for processing large-scale surveys. Implements different estimators with sampling errors, and ships with a dedicated GUI (package [ReGenesees.GUI](https://github.com/DiegoZardetto/ReGenesees.GUI)).

name: vardpoor
description: Linearization of non-linear statistics and variance estimation.

name: convey
description: Variance estimation on indicators of income concentration and poverty using complex sample survey designs. Wrapper around the survey package.

name: icarus
description: Provides detailed tools for performing calibration and several of its varitations, in a familiar setting for Calmar users in SAS.

name: gustave
description: Provides a toolkit for analytical variance estimation in survey sampling.

name: rtrim
description: Trends and Indices for Monitoring data. Provides tools for estimating animal/plant populations based on site counts, including occurrence of missing data.

name: surveysd
description: Calibration, bootstrap and error estimation for complex surveys.

name: inca
description: Calibration weighting with integer weights.

name: piar
description: Provides tools to make price indexes that aggregate a collection of elemental indexes according to a hierarchical structure. Includes methods to flexibly build indexes from multiple sources of data, chain indexes over time, and construct product contributions.

name: X-13ARIMA-SEATS
description: seasonal adjustment software, by Census Bureau produced maintained and distributed by the US Census Bureau.

name: seasonal
description: Interface to the `X13-ARIMA-SEATS` program from R with a very nice shiny GUI.

name: x12
description: Alternative interface to the `X13-ARIMA-SEATS` program from R with a focus on batch processing time series.

name: JDemetra+
description: The seasonal adjustment software officially recommended for the European Statistical System.

name: rjdverse
description: Ecosystem of R-packages around JDemetra+ such as [RJDemetra](https://github.com/rjdverse/rjdemetra) for v2 and rjd3* for v3

name: tempdisagg
description: Methods for temporal disaggregation and interpolation of time series.

name: nonprobsvy
description: Statistical inference with non-probability samples when auxiliary information is available from external sources such as probability samples or population totals or means. The package implements inverse probability weighting, mass imputation and doubly robust estimators possibly with high-dimensional covariates.

name: SSBtools
description: Includes functionality to compute tabular aggregates according to a hierarchical structure. For example, using the package's functions [model_aggregate()](https://statisticsnorway.github.io/ssb-ssbtools/reference/model_aggregate.html), [tables_by_formulas()](https://statisticsnorway.github.io/ssb-ssbtools/reference/tables_by_formulas.html) and [quantile_weighted()](https://statisticsnorway.github.io/ssb-ssbtools/reference/quantile_weighted.html). It also is a dependency package for several packages under "Statistical disclosure control".

name: validate
description: Rule management and data validation.

name: nrba
description: Facilitates nonresponse bias analysis (NRBA) and nonresponse adjustments for survey data.

name: Mu-ARGUS
description: Tool to create safe micro-data files. See also the [casc page](http://research.cbs.nl/casc/).

type: Java C++ Fortran and Delphi application
name: T-ARGUS
description: Tool to protect statistical tables. See also the [casc page](http://research.cbs.nl/casc/).

name: sdcMicro
description: Disclosure control for statistical microdata.

name: sdcTable
description: Disclosure control for tabulated data.

name: easySdcTable
description: Provides an interface to the package sdcTable.

name: GaussSuppression
description: Tabular data suppression using the Gaussian elimination secondary suppression algorithm.

name: sdcHierarchies
description: Allows to generate, modify and export nested hierarchies.

name: SmallCountRounding
description: Can be used to protect frequency tables by rounding necessary inner cells so that cross-classifications to be published are safe.

name: simPop
description: Simulation of synthetic populations from census/survey data considering auxiliary information.

name: sdcSpatial
description: Create privacy protected density maps from location data. Includes visual sensitivity assessment and several protection methods.

name: synthpop
description: Produce synthetic versions of microdata containing confidential information so that they are safe to be released to users for exploratory analysis.

name: SDMX_Converter
description: Converts between SDMX versions and formats like CSV, FLR etc. By Eurostat.

name: SDMX-RI
description: Framework for disseminating data in SDMX webservices. By Eurostat.

name: PxStat
description: Data Dissemination Management System for creating and publishing Statistics over the Web with focus on Accessibility and LOD. By [CSO](https://www.cso.ie/).

name: PxWeb_
description: Web application for dissemination of statistical tables in [Px format](https://www.scb.se/en/services/statistical-programs-for-px-files/px-file-format/) or SQL data in the [Nordic Data Model](https://www.scb.se/en/services/statistical-programs-for-px-files/px-web/px-web-med-sql-databas/).

name: pxmake
description: Create and manipulate PX-files from R. By Statistics Greenland.

name: .Stat_Suite
description: An SDMX-based platform to build tailored data portals, topical or regional data explorers, or lightweight reporting platforms. [Documentation](https://sis-cc.gitlab.io/dotstatsuite-documentation). By [SIS-CC](https://siscc.org).

name: ISTAT Statkit
description: A toolkit to facilitate the standardization and industrialization of statistical dissemination and reporting based on SDMX. By ISTAT.

name: SDMX-JSON
description: JSON variant of SDMX. Works together with the [SDMX-REST API](https://github.com/sdmx-twg/sdmx-rest).

name: JSON-stat
description: Simple lightweight JSON format for statistical dissemination. Based on a Cube model with dimensions organised in categories. This [tools page](https://json-stat.org/tools/) contains a list of software to work with it.

name: cols4all
description: Color palettes generation and analysis with support for color-blind-friendliness and fairness. Supports categorical, sequential, diverging and bivariate color palettes and colors for missing values.

name: tabplot
description: Compare up to about 10-20 variables simultaneously using a [tableplot](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/tabplot/vignettes/tabplot-vignette.html). See also [tabplotd3](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=tabplot) for a web-based GUI. Note: 2022-03-03: Temporarily not on Cran but expected to be back in 2022.

name: tmap
description: Thematic geographic maps, including bubble charts, choropleths, and more.

name: Gridviz
description: Javascript library for gridded statistics maps, on the web. By Eurostat.

name: Eurostat-map
description: Javascript library for customizable thematic maps for global and regional statistical data. By Eurostat.

name: oceanis
description: To create maps for statistical analysis such as proportional circles, chroropleth, typology and flows. By INSEE.

name: cartomap
description: A (growing) list of simplified maps useful for web cartography for World, Europe and countries.

name: Nuts2json
description: Simplified geometries for web maps of European NUTS regions. By Eurostat.

name: treemap
description: Space-filling visualisation of hierarchical data.

name: btb
description: Conservative kernel smoothing method for spatial analysis.

name: StatMiner
description: Experimental visualization framework from Statistics Netherlands.

name: Visual
description: Javascript library for data visualization that encapsulates complexity supporting chart types such as bar, rank, pie, time series bar/line, population pyramid, scatterplots and Choropleth maps. By Idescat.

name: PantaRhei
description: Sankey plots suited for (circulair) economical systems such as energy systems, material flow accounts and water accounts. Supports loops.

name: SDMX Dashboard Generator
description: Open-source web application for SDMX data and metadata rendering based on Dash.

name: rsdmx
description: Access to data or metadata from statistical organisations that support SDMX webservices. The package contains a list of SDMX access points of various national and international statistical institutes.

name: readsdmx
description: Read SDMX into dataframes from local SDMX-ML file or web-service. Parts in C++. By OECD.

name: sdmx
description: Python library (called ‘sdmx1’ on PyPI) implementing SDMX 2.1 and 3.0 to access SDMX data providers and convert it into Pandas objects.

name: JSON-stat Toolkit
description: Set of software around JSON-stat, such as the [JavaScript Toolkit](https://www.npmjs.com/package/jsonstat-toolkit), [command line conversion](https://www.npmjs.com/package/jsonstat-conv), and access to [eurostat data](https://www.npmjs.com/package/jsonstat-euro).

name: rjstat
description: Read and write data sets in the JSON-stat format in R.

name: pyjstat
description: Read and write data sets in the JSON-stat format in Python.

name: json-stat.java
description: Read and write JSON-stat. By Statistics Norway.

name: OECD
description: Search and Extract Data from the OECD

name: sorvi
description: Finnish Open Government Data Toolkit, historical maps

name: eurostat
description: Tools to download data from the Eurostat database together with search and manipulation utilities.

name: restatapi
description: Search and retrieve data from Eurostat database, by Eurostat.

name: acs
description: Download, Manipulate, and Present American Community Survey and Decennial Data from the US Census.

name: inegiR
description: Access to data published by [INEGI](http://www.inegi.org.mx/), Mexico's official statistics agency.

name: cbsodataR
description: Access to Statistics Netherlands' ([CBS](http://www.CBS.nl)) open data API from R.

name: cbsodata4
description: Access to OData4 interface of Statistics Netherlands' ([CBS](http://www.CBS.nl)) open data.

name: cbsodata.js
description: Access to Statistics Netherlands' ([CBS](http://www.CBS.nl)) open data API from js.

name: cbsodata.py
description: Access to Statistics Netherlands' ([CBS](http://www.CBS.nl)) open data API from Python.

name: censusapi
description: A wrapper for the U.S. Census Bureau APIs that returns data frames of Census data and metadata.

name: CANSIM2R
description: Extract CANSIM (Statistics Canada) tables and transform them into readily usable data.

name: pyscbwrapper
description: Access to the open data API of the Swedish Statistical Institute

name: pxweb
description: Generic interface for the PX-Web/PC-Axis API used by many National Statistical Agencies.

name: PxWebApiData
description: Easy API access to e.g. Statistics Norway, Statistics Sweden and Statistics Finland.

name: pxR
description: Functions for reading and writing PC-Axis files.

name: rdbnomics
description: Access to the [DB.nomics database](https://next.nomics.world/) which provide macroeconomic data from 38 official providers such as INSEE, Eurostat, World bank, etc.

name: readabs
description: Download data from the Australian Bureau of Statistics.

name: statcanR
description: An R connection to Statistics Canada's Web Data Service. Open economic data (formerly CANSIM tables) are accessible as a data frame in the R environment.

name: cdlTools
description: Downloads USDA National Agricultural Statistics Service (NASS) cropscape data for a specified state.

name: SDMX_Connectors
description: Browse SDMX data providers, build your queries and get data directly in your favourite tool (R, SAS, Matlab, Stata and Excel). By Banca d'Italia.

name: sdmx-rest
description: This library allows to easily create and execute SDMX REST queries from a JavaScript client application.

name: csodata
description: Download data from Central Statistics Office (CSO) of Ireland.

name: czso
description: Access open data from the Czech Statistical Office.

name: ipumsr
description: Access to the Integrated Public Use Microdata Series archive ipums.org (international censuses, harmonized U.S. data).

name: eph
description: Tools to download and manipulate the [EPH-INDEC](https://www.indec.gob.ar/) from Argentina (EPH is the Spanish acronym for Permanent Household Survey)

name: blsR
description: Make Requests to the BLS (Bureau of Labor Statistics) API

name: danstat
description: R Client for the Statistics Denmark Databank API

name: restatis
description: R API Client for the German Federal Statistical Office Database

name: pystatis
description: Python wrapper for GENESIS web service interface (API) of the Federal Statistical Office

name: TEMPO
description: Provides access to the Online database from the Romanian [National Institute of Statistics](https://insse.ro)

name: cancensus
description: Access to Canadian Census Data and Geography

name: nomisr
description: Access UK Census and LFS statistics from the 'Nomis' database

name: insee
description: Access to the INSEE 'bdm' macroeconomic database

name: STATcubeR
description: Access to STATcube, the statistical database of Statistics Austria and the open data portal of Statistics Austria
